diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Acute blood loss anemia from gastrointestinal bleeding; Sphincter of oddi dysfunction; Acute allergic reaction to Nalbuphine and fentanyl; Allergic reaction to multiple narcotics
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient experienced recurrent abdominal pain and underwent an elective ERCP for evaluation of sphincter of Oddi dysfunction. Following the procedure, she developed severe abdominal pain, which, in conjunction with her history and findings, led to the diagnosis of acute pancreatitis post ERCP.
